intro: Phelypaea tenuiflora, commonly known as slender-flowered phelypaea, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants characterized by their spadix and spathe structures. The plant typically grows in wet, shady environments such as swamps and marshes. Its leaves are elongated and narrow, often with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered around a spadix, typical of the arum family.
